page.title: 01Summary-Tumble and Cwmmawr.
page.content: The block contains the villages of Tumble and Cwmmawr with 29 farms on the fringes of both. The village of Tumble is reputedly with others one of the largest in Wales. It has been divided into two, Lower and Upper Tumble. Population is approx. 3 000. For Local Government purposes the area comes under Dyfed C.C., Llanelli B.C. and Llannon Community Council. Both villages are linked to the M4, A48 and the A476 by the B4310 which also joins the B4317 at Cwmmawr. The landscape surrounding both villages is predominantly rough grassland with small man made plantations of coniferous trees and small natural deciduous forests. Running from N.E. to S.W. there is a ridge with the highest point being 246m. The land drops suddenly to the N.W. down to the River Gwendraeth Fawr
